sentences.cn: …一位前任委内瑞拉外交部长。

sentences.en: Among the speakers at the gathering was Treasury Secretary Nicholas Brady.
sentences.cn: 与会的发言人中有财政部长尼古拉斯·布莱迪。

sentences.en: He liked the Secretary no better than his assistant.
sentences.cn: 他讨厌这位大臣的程度几乎和讨厌大臣的助理一样。

sentences.en: He was involved in a legal wrangle with the Health Secretary.
sentences.cn: 他卷入了与卫生大臣的法律纠纷之中。

sentences.en: I escalated to the dizzy heights of director's secretary.
sentences.cn: 我升到了总经理秘书这一显赫高位。

sentences.en: Mr Byers last night demanded an immediate explanation from the Education Secretary.
sentences.cn: 昨晚拜尔斯先生要求教育大臣立刻作出解释。

sentences.en: My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.
sentences.cn: 我的祖父是苏格兰矿工工会干事。

sentences.en: My secretary will fax you all the details.
sentences.cn: 我的秘书会把所有的细节发传真给你。

sentences.en: Pop it in the post, or get your secretary to fax it.
sentences.cn: 把它扔进邮筒，要不然就让你的秘书发份传真。

sentences.en: She penned a short memo to his private secretary.
sentences.cn: 她给他的私人秘书写了一份简短的备忘录。

sentences.en: The final word will still come from the Secretary of State.
sentences.cn: 最后仍然要由国务卿来定夺。

sentences.en: The Foreign Secretary's views on the treaty are well-documented and oft-repeated.
sentences.cn: 外交大臣就该条约发表的观点有大量记述并被屡屡提及。

sentences.en: The Health Secretary called for a return to traditional family values.
sentences.cn: 卫生部部长呼吁传统家庭价值观的回归。

sentences.en: The Home Secretary is considering a new law against stalking.
sentences.cn: 内务大臣正考虑制定一项针对跟踪骚扰的新法律。

sentences.en: The Secretary of State has given in to special pleading.
sentences.cn: 国务卿已被那些诡辩之词给说服了。

sentences.en: the secretary of the tennis club
The Secretary's letter questions my veracity and impugns my motives.
sentences.cn: 部长的来信怀疑我的诚实，质疑我的动机。

sentences.en: They placed an advertisement in the local paper for a secretary.
sentences.cn: 他们在当地报纸上登了一则招聘秘书的广告。

words.tran_cn: 秘书处；书记处；秘书（书记，部长等）之职
书记、秘书等的职务或任期

phrases.tran_cn: 布政司；主任秘书；书记官长
执行秘书；行政秘书；总经理秘书
n. （美）国务卿；（英）国务大臣；（美）州政府秘书长

trans.tran_en: someone who works in an office  typing  letters, keeping records, answering telephone calls, arranging meetings etc
someone who works in an office  typing  letters, keeping records, answering telephone calls, arranging meetings etc
